instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
threads.message:
I found this: [url]https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Bourns/CRM1206-FX-47R0ELF?qs=sGAEpiMZZMtlleCFQhR%2FzfYCrtwYTFJmcM3xzJGTcLs%3D[/url]

But I am not sure if that is the right one, I also need the 10ohm one 

Any help and link will be greatly appreciated!

threads.title: Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
threads.message:
I just found this ones: [url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/SUSUMU-Current-Sense-Thin-Film-Resistor-470-mOhms-1-0805-1-3W-SMD-NEW-Qty-50/202092098519?hash=item2f0da0b3d7:g:GasAAOSw5cNYGCoZ[/url]

But still unsure if they will work

threads.title: Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
threads.message:
While will you want to buy 47, 470, or even 10 ohm resistors???
The main power supply needs 10 and 20 miliohm resistors (0.010-0.020 ohm).
Other places on the MacBook boards have 2, or 5 miliohm resistors.
Be aware of the marking codes!

threads.title: Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
threads.message: Shoot... so there is no place to get those resistors in bulk? I got 4 jobs in here with problems where I had to use those resistors and I don't have any more...

threads.title: Where to buy MacBook current sense resistors
threads.message:
20 miliohm can be found on normal laptop boards too.
10 miliohm is not so much used there; more in Apple stuff.
I'm sure you can get them in bulk from some online store, but you must search for correct values.
Size is not so important, as you can scratch the paint to place them.

Some of them look like 4 terminals; two common pins in pair.
